column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=The A4–xBxNi3O10 samples (A and B = La, Pr, and Nd;
#Text=x = 0, 1, 2, and 3) were synthesized via the citrate precursor
#Text=method [27,30], the details of which are given in Appendix
#Text=A.
#Text=These precursors have been annealed at 1100 °C in oxygen
#Text=atmosphere for 24 h, except for La4Ni3O10 (which does not
#Text=require oxygen atmosphere) and Nd4Ni3O10 (which needs a
#Text=reacting time of 72 h).
#Text=The compacted and pelleted samples for electronic-transport measurements were obtained by
#Text=pressing the powder and annealing again at 1100 °C in oxygen
#Text=atmosphere for 24 h.
#Text=All samples were characterized by
#Text=powder XRD at room temperature [Fig. 1(a)], and the results
#Text=show sharp peaks without visible impurities.
#Text=The elemental
#Text=compositions of all samples were confirmed by EDX (see
#Text=Appendix C).
#Text=According to our thermogravimetric analysis,
#Text=we can confirm an almost stoichiometric oxygen content for
#Text=all compounds with values around 10.0 within 1% or better
#Text=(see Table II in Appendix B).
